title: How to Make a Hair Protectant Spray

steps.title: Pour the water into a spray bottle.
steps.content: Pour the water into a spray bottle. You can mix your hair protectant spray in the bottle that you plan to keep it in. Start by filling the bottle with 6 ounces (177 ml) of distilled or filtered water. Because the water is denser than the oil, it’s important to add it first so they mix properly. [1] X Research source You can use a plastic or glass spray bottle, but make sure that it holds 7 ounces (207 ml) or more.

steps.title: Add the avocado oil.
steps.content: Add the avocado oil. Once you’ve added the water to the bottle, mix in 24 to 36 drops of avocado oil. Add more oil if you have thick, coarse hair and less oil if you have fine or thin hair. [2] X Research source The ratio of oil to water for the spray is 4 to 6 drops for every ounce (30 ml) of water. You can adjust the recipe to make as much or as little of the protectant spray as you need. You can substitute other oils for the avocado. Sunflower, argan, and macadamia nut oil are other options to consider.

steps.title: Shake the bottle to combine the ingredients.
steps.content: Shake the bottle to combine the ingredients. After you’ve added the oil, shake the bottle vigorously to combine the water and oil. The spray may separate while you’re storing it, so be sure to shake it well before each use. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Spray the mixture over your hair before heat styling.
steps.content: Spray the mixture over your hair before heat styling. When you want to use the hair protectant spray, lightly mist it over your hair. [4] X Expert Source Michael Van den Abbeel Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 7 January 2019. Use your fingers or a comb to work the spray through your hair so you know all of the strands are coated. Next, style your hair with your favorite heated tool, such as a curling iron, flat iron, or blow dryer, as usual. [5] X Research source You can use the spray on wet or dry hair.

steps.title: Fill a spray bottle with water.
steps.content: Fill a spray bottle with water. Pour 1 cup (237 ml) of distilled water into a spray bottle. Make sure the bottle is large enough that there is approximately 2 inches (5 cm) of space at the top of the bottle. [6] X Research source You can use a plastic or glass spray bottle for the hair protectant spray.

steps.title: Add the coconut oil and almond oil.
steps.content: Add the coconut oil and almond oil. With the water in the bottle, mix in 1 tablespoon (13 g) of melted coconut oil and 4 drops of almond oil. It usually helps to use a medicine dropper to add the oils to the bottle. [7] X Research source You can substitute argan or grapeseed oil for the almond oil if you prefer.

steps.title: Mix in some hair conditioner.
steps.content: Mix in some hair conditioner. When the water and oils are mixed in the bottle, squeeze a quarter-sized amount of your favorite conditioner into the palm of your hand. Carefully transfer it into the bottle with the other ingredients. [8] X Research source You can use whatever conditioner that you like, but be sure that it contains silicones. They are the ingredients that help coat your hair to protect it.

steps.title: Shake the bottle to blend all of the ingredients.
steps.content: Shake the bottle to blend all of the ingredients. Once all of the ingredients are in the spray bottle, mix them together by shaking the bottle well. The spray may separate when you’re storing it, so remember to shake it before each use. [9] X Research source Don’t be concerned if the mixture has some lather or suds after you shake it together. That’s entirely normal. The spray will settle into a milky liquid once it has time to sit.

steps.title: Apply the spray to your hair before using heat.
steps.content: Apply the spray to your hair before using heat. When you’re ready to use the spray, hold the bottle approximately 6 inches (15 cm) from your head and mist it over your hair evenly. Work the spray through your hair with your fingers, and heat style as usual. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Pour half of the water into a spray bottle.
steps.content: Pour half of the water into a spray bottle. To mix the hair protectant spray, add ½ cup (118.5 ml) of distilled water to a spray bottle. Make sure that the bottle can hold at least 10 ounces (296 ml) so there’s room to add the rest of the ingredients. [11] X Research source Because the hair protectant spray contains essential oils, use a glass spray bottle to hold it. Essential oils can break down more quickly in a plastic container.

steps.title: Add all of the remaining ingredients.
steps.content: Add all of the remaining ingredients. With half of the water in the spray bottle, mix in 1 teaspoon (4.5 g) of fractionated coconut oil, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of sweet almond oil, and 2 teaspoons (10 g) of hair conditioner. Next, add 5 drops of clary sage essential oil and 5 drops of geranium essential oil. [12] X Research source You can use whatever conditioner you usually use on your hair.

steps.title: Top the mixture off with remaining water and shake well.
steps.content: Top the mixture off with remaining water and shake well. With all of the other ingredients in the spray bottle, add the remaining ½ cup (118.5 ml) of distilled water. Shake the bottle well to blend all of the ingredients. [13] X Research source Shake the hair protectant spray before each use in case the oils have separated from the water.

steps.title: Spritz your hair with the spray and work it through.
steps.content: Spritz your hair with the spray and work it through. To use this heat protectant, apply one spray to your hair. Use your fingers or a comb to work it through your tresses until all of your hair is coated. Style your hair with your curling iron, flat iron, or blow dryer as usual. [14] X Research source
